name: social-housing-asset-value
notes:
Leeds City Council provides data on the value of its social housing assets in accordance with the Local Government Transparency Code.

PLEASE NOTE

  • As the value may differ between tenanted sale value and the market value you may want to add a note to say that the market value is a potential value. The publication of this information does not imply an end to tenancy agreements.

USEFUL INFORMATION

  • Valuation Sub Band - indicates the value band ranges in the post code sector.
  • EUV Total - this column indicates the the Existing Use Value total. EUV is the price at which a property could be sold on the open market assuming that it can only be used for the existing use for the foreseeable future.
  • Market Value -  is the most probable price (in terms of money) which a property should bring in a competitive and open market.

Further information can be found by following the Local Government Transparency Code 2015 below.

LOCAL GOVERNMENT TRANSPARENCY CODE 2015

  • This is a key dataset which the government wants local authorities to publish.
  • https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/local-government-transparency-code-2015
title: Social Housing Asset Value
